reviews.text: Spent 2 nights in this lovely hotel. Room was spacious and well-kept and we had a view of the harbor, which was great! We had one of the rooms the farthest away from the elevators and unlike some of the other reviewers on here, we didn't think it was a long walk and on the other hand enjoyed being completely away from the lobby and the noises!
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location and service!

reviews.text: Hotel staff was very nice and helpful with giving directions, suggestions to restaurants etc. Parking lot is clearly not made for SUVs and the likes, but we still managed to get a good spot. Pool area was lovely, especially with the outdoor chairs, we spent a nice afternoon swimming and sunbathing.
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very conveniently located. Within walking distance from the city centre with shopping and restaurants. Right next door is the visitor's centre and the city buses leave from there. The buses can take you to some of the Mansions, for example the Breakers, so you can leave your car at the hotel, which we enjoyed!
reviews.title: Great Location Great Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great value! Room was cheaper than anything else in Newport at the time. Rooms were fresh and clean. Breakfast was okay, but a great place to stay in Newport in the center of town for a great price. Stayed here with family last minute and would recommend it. Walking distance to everything.
reviews.title: Very disappointing and very expensive for quality

reviews.text: Thanks to my friend who got us booked in this hotel. Great location in terms of accesiblity for transport and food. Rather than staying in Manhattan and paying a bomb for it, i would recommend staying here and taking a train to Manhattan. Turns out to be chepaer and convinient. Rooms are comfortable and area is very safe to move around. Great place for Business as well as Lesiure travellers.
reviews.title: Great location & clean

reviews.text: The Front Desk Management really takes care of you. Clean hotel with good views of the harbor. Will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: The Managers Take Care of You

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a conference and were charmed by the nautical theme throughout the hotel--pictures of America's Cup yachts, signal flags on the bedspreads, captain's chairs in the rooms, etc. Service was great, as were amenities. Unfortunately, we were too busy to spend much time at the pool, but we took full advantage of the views afforded by the waterfront location.
reviews.title: Great stay in a beautiful spot

reviews.text: The hotel is smack-dab in the middle of quaint shops, restaurants, and the harbor, meaning walking distance to everything.
reviews.title: It's OK

reviews.text: The hotel it self is nice and close to all attractions. The cost to stay is out of line for the money. I found the staff to be helpful and willing to do what is needed. If you can stay for $150 that would be about the right price
reviews.title: Marriott Exemplifies Customer Service in Newport!

reviews.text: A recent business trip was made thoroughly enjoyable with the staff at this hotel. Everyone I encountered from maids, front desk, catering manager, was courteous, personable, and genuinely happy to be there. The rooms are spotless and comfortable, the views of Newport Harbor are spectacular, and I cannot wait to return to this hotel. One banquet host, Meg, may very well be the nicest person I've ever encountered in business travel. She is a true gem in the travel and hotel industry. Ideally this location is best suited for couples, business travelers and families with older children < 8. The historic features of Newport would be difficult to traverse with a stroller in tow. I cannot say enough good things about this beautiful hotel and an amazing staff! What a treat!
reviews.title: Nice but expensive

reviews.text: The Newport Marriott is in a GREAT location with helpful, friendly staff. They have done an excellent job using nautical themed decor and upholstery to update and improve upon a fairly poorly designed property. There's a distinct sense of bad late 1970's design (read any of the reviews of folks who got interior facing rooms) but our small room was really lovely -- navy and crimson with gold accents and very comfortable beds. Our view included a parking lot, but I'm an optimist, so we all focused more on the impressive Claiborne Pell bridge and river in the distance. The pool is great and the staff managed some rowdy twenty-somethings on a wedding weekend very handily. More young wedding guests made the 2 - 4 am timeframe quite noisy. The walls are THIN. The huge sails that form the theme in the main lobby are a great way to use dated space and my kids thought the lobby was really cool.
reviews.title: Great location for family fun, shopping and restaurants, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Couple of important pointers when making your reservation:
reviews.title: perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. do NOT accept an interior-facing room unless you are offered one well away from the elevator lobby on each floor. Really bizarre design.
reviews.title: Given a choice, I'd choose somewhere else

reviews.text: 2. Ask how far your room is from the elevators. Our room had a very acceptable view (#579) but it was a LONG walk from the elevators. If you have any physical limitations or have a small child in tow -- the strange shape of this hotel can make your room location extremely inconvenient.
reviews.title: Good for business, but ...

reviews.text: 3. Book a special "breakfast included" rate and enjoy the well-appointed breakfast buffet in the Fathoms hotel restaurant. GREAT for families with kids. Skip the restaurant for other meals and enjoy the many choices in town.
reviews.title: RUDE! RUDE! RUDE!

reviews.text: The place is very nice, clean and staff professional. Although their rates are normally higher than other surrounding hotels, it's definitely worth the extra cash.
reviews.title: I very nice hotel conveniently located in the heart of Newport

reviews.text: I'm a longtime Marriott Rewards Member. This Marriott is in a wonderful location and Marriott seems content to take that,...and you...for granted. The hotel is OVERPRICED. It's an old Holiday Inn and feels every bit of it. Simple things. Lighting is awful in the rooms. Carpet depressing. No 24-7 food and beverage spot...it simply closes down. Instead, you're directed to find a tiny alcove on the third floor which has a single candy machine. There is nothing attractive or remotely welcoming to this place. Very underwhelming and disappointing. What a shame. What a ripoff.
reviews.title: Awful...not worth it!

reviews.text: I guess my review might have been different is I was there a different time of year and not just for work. My first room was a massive disappointment (window faced the elevator inside view very dark and Noisy) so I requested a change and the only other available room was a double bed instead of a King but I took it to get away from the depressing darkness and noisiness of elevator traffic just outside the bedroom window. My other room had view of the Panera across the street but at least was quiet and the bed was adequate. The conf room facilities were okay, the facility food was okay but nothing to scream wonderful about. I travel a lot and I guess I am jaded that this Marriott seemed older and tired and overpriced for what it offered. I don't spend a lot of time out east so maybe my midwest sensibilities got in the way of giving this a better review.
reviews.title: Nice location but not even as nice as other Hamptons I've stayed at

reviews.text: I couldn't have asked for a better location. It's walking distance to most of what you'd want to do and, if not, it's just a short drive.
reviews.title: Staff was uncommonly rude, but location was wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One complaint would be the inward facing rooms, which means the windows are inside the hotel so the room is very, very dark and you have to have the drapes shut if you want any privacy. If you book a room here, try to specifically reserve a room with outward facing windows.
reviews.title: So-So
